trans-unit.source: 1979 - The Grid Compass was used by Nasa on the space shuttle program in the early 1980's.
1981 - The Osborne 1 weighed 24lbs and cost $1795. It came with a five-inch screen, a modem port, two 5 1/4 floppy drives, and software applications.
1983 - The TRS 80 weighed 4lbs and was powered by AA batteries.
1988 - The Compaq SLT/286 was the first laptop with VGA graphics and cost approximately $5399.
1991 - The Macintosh Powerbook 100 series established the form factor for all modern laptops.
2006 - Laptops are designed with built-in wireless functionality, long battery life, compact design, and comparable desktop performance.
2006 â€“ IBM T-series Thinkpad designed for highly mobile users with outstanding functionality and long battery life in an easily portable, thin and light design.
Click each year for more information.
